This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
library("ggplot2")
library("gplots")
library("plyr")
library("RCurl")
library("reshape2")
library("grid")
source("../01 Data/SQLData.R")
# 1st plot
p1 <- ggplot(dfcomb,aes(x=as.Date(ORDER_DATE,"%Y-%m-%d") ,y=as.Date(SHIPPED_DATE,"%Y-%m-%d"))) + geom_point(aes(color=as.factor(UNIT_PRICE)))
p1+facet_wrap(~CUSTOMER_STATE)

# 2nd plot
p2 <- ggplot(dfcomb,aes(x=as.Date(ORDER_DATE,"%Y-%m-%d") ,y=as.Date(SHIPPED_DATE,"%Y-%m-%d"))) + geom_point(aes(color=as.factor(TITLE)))
p2+facet_wrap(~CUSTOMER_STATE)

# 3rd plot
p3 <- ggplot(dfcomb,aes(x=as.Date(ORDER_DATE,"%Y-%m-%d") ,y=as.Date(SHIPPED_DATE,"%Y-%m-%d"))) + geom_point(aes(color=as.factor(ARTIST)))
p3+facet_wrap(~CUSTOMER_STATE)

```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(cars)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
